title: Liverpool legend Steven Gerrard says Chelsea rivalry is ''hatred for 90 minutes'' ahead of Blues' trip to Anfield
text:
Sport Liverpool legend Steven Gerrard says Chelsea rivalry is ''hatred for 90 minutes'' ahead of Blues' trip to Anfield Gerrard had some epic tussles with Chelsea both domestically and in Europe, and says the rivalry between the two sides is underestimated Share Gerrard has opened up on the rivalry with Chelsea (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Liverpool legend Steven Gerrard has opened up on the Reds' rivalry with Chelsea, stating the match is 'hatred for 90 minutes'. 
The Blues travel to Anfield for the latest installment of the fixture on Tuesday evening as they bid to strengthen their position at the summit of the Premier League. 
Liverpool are looking to reverse their form having picked up just one win in eight matches since the turn of the year. 
Gerrard had some epic tussles with Chelsea both domestically and in Europe, and says the rivalry between the two sides is underestimated. 
He said ahead of the game which is live on BT Sport: "I think the rivalry [between Liverpool & Chelsea] was bigger than what people thought. Gerrard has spoken ahead of Tuesday night's clash (Photo: BT Sport) Gerrard watches on as Demba Ba scores at Anfield (Photo: Kent Gavin/Daily Mirror) 
"For me, being a Liverpool player and a Liverpool fan, to get any kind of success at some stage we had to knock Chelsea out. 
"They were the most powerful team, but became the most powerful team and club financial wise but also the player influx. For us to get any kind of success we knew we had to get the better of them. 
"It’s almost like hatred for 90 minutes. The feeling you get in your body is weird but as soon as the final whistle you need to go back straight away to being respectful. 
"Obviously it’s a lot more difficult when on the losing end." Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
